derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from obsolete French papeline, perhaps from Italian papalina (feminine) 'papal', referring to the town of Avignon (residence of popes in exile (1309–77), and site of papal property), where it was first made

entry.def: Poplin is a type of cotton material used to make clothes.

means.word_mean: 1. a ribbed fabric used in clothing and upholstery
